questions.question: What is sd-dynamic-thresholding and what does it do?
questions.answer: sd-dynamic-thresholding is an extension for ComfyUI, StableSwarmUI, and AUTOMATIC1111 Stable Diffusion WebUI that enables higher CFG Scales without color issues. It works by clamping latents between steps.

questions.question: Who developed the core functionality of sd-dynamic-thresholding?
questions.answer: The core functionality of sd-dynamic-thresholding was originally developed by Birch-san and later ported to the WebUI by dtan3847.

questions.question: How can I install sd-dynamic-thresholding in ComfyUI?
questions.answer: You can use either of the following methods: Option A (TODO: Manager install), or Option B: `cd ComfyUI/custom_nodes` & `git clone https://github.com/mcmonkeyprojects/sd-dynamic-thresholding` and then restart ComfyUI.

questions.question: What node should I add in ComfyUI to use sd-dynamic-thresholding?
questions.answer: Add node `advanced/mcmonkey/DynamicThresholdingSimple` (or `Full`) in ComfyUI to use the extension.

questions.question: How can I configure sd-dynamic-thresholding within the Infinity Grid Generator extension?
questions.answer: Please refer to the readme of the Infinity Grid Generator extension for details on how to configure sd-dynamic-thresholding.

questions.question: Which versions of the ComfyUI KSampler node can use the sd-dynamic-thresholding?
questions.answer: The extension can work with any variant of the `KSampler` node, including custom ones, as long as they do not totally override the internal sampling function.

questions.question: What licensing pre-note should I be aware of when using sd-dynamic-thresholding?
questions.answer: This is an open source project provided entirely freely, so if you make any changes that could benefit the community as a whole, please contribute upstream.

questions.question: What does the MIT License permit in the context of the sd-dynamic-thresholding usage?
questions.answer: The MIT License permits you to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sell, and sublicense copies of the tool, subject to certain conditions.

questions.question: What does the license not permit in the case of the sd-dynamic-thresholding usage?
questions.answer: You may not hold any developer liable for what you do with the software.
